medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and right upper quadrant pain for 48 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly two days prior to admission, initially presenting as sharp and cramping epigastric pain that spread to the right upper quadrant and flank. The pain was moving and was relieved only with heat. On the day of presentation, the patient experienced decreased appetite, mild constipation, presence of flatus, and chills, and denied nausea, vomiting, or fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension; Obesity; Previous C-section and bilateral salpingectomies.
